summary: This is an email chain from December 11, 2007, regarding the Epstein case. The sender is preparing to compile evidence for a de novo review of the proposed indictment, including state interviews and FBI 302s, and has drafted a letter to someone named Jay. The email references recent correspondence from the law firm Kirkland & Ellis.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: The sender mentions drafting a letter intended for Jay, indicating Jay is likely a legal professional or official involved in the case review.

events.title: Email regarding evidence review for Epstein case
events.description: An email is sent discussing the need to compile evidence, including state interview recordings and FBI 302s, for a de novo review of the proposed indictment against Epstein, prompted by recent Kirkland & Ellis correspondence.

keyFacts: A de novo review of the evidence for the proposed Epstein indictment was being initiated as of December 11, 2007.
The review was prompted by recent correspondence from the law firm Kirkland & Ellis.
The available evidence included audio/videotapes of all state interviews and FBI 302s, though not all interviews had transcripts.
A letter was drafted to an individual named Jay in connection with this review process.
